alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 10 at 12:55AM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Northern High Plains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 5 PM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
